back: To give up completely; to desert

meanings.definition: To leave a place, thing, or person, usually forever.
examples: We had to abandon the car.
By the time the rebel troops arrived, the village had already been abandoned.
As a baby, he was abandoned by his mother.
Abandon ship! We were sinking fast, and the captain gave the order to abandon ship.

meanings.definition: To stop doing an activity before you have finished it.
examples: The game was abandoned at half-time because of the poor weather conditions.
They had to abandon their attempt to climb the mountain.
The party has now abandoned its policy of unilateral disarmament.

idioms.definition: To leave a ship because it is sinking or in danger.
examples: The captain gave the order to abandon ship.

definitions.definition: To leave somebody, especially somebody you are responsible for, with no intention of returning.
examples: The baby had been abandoned by its mother.
People often simply abandon their pets when they go abroad.

definitions.definition: To stop doing something, especially before it is finished; to stop having something.
examples: They abandoned the match because of rain.
She abandoned hope of any reconciliation.
We had to abandon any further attempt at negotiation.

oxford.wordOrigin: Late Middle English: from Old French abandoner, from a- (from Latin ad ‘to, at’) + bandon ‘control’.

idioms.definition: To leave a ship because it is sinking.
examples: The captain gave the order to abandon ship.
